intro: Dischistocalyx polyneurus, commonly known as the Chinese hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
